messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 477
messages.msgSnippet: To those of you in NJ...I m in NJ too!!!...Ramsey...yes abit away from you, but how old are your dear children...My son is still young..3.. but I have always
messages.messageBody:
To those of you in NJ...I'm in NJ too!!!...Ramsey...yes abit away from you,
but how old are your dear children...My son is still young..3.. but I have
always known I would
home/unschool him. I am having trouble finding a group near me...would
certainly
love the idea of meeting..just to know there is someone else out there..you
can email me off list if you'd like...
Eileen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 477
messages.msgSnippet: Hello everyone, I am a homeschooling father with four children.  My two oldest children are working on a SpaceDay Challenge for NASA that involves the
messages.messageBody:
Hello everyone,

I am a homeschooling father with four children. My two oldest children are
working on a SpaceDay Challenge for NASA that involves the International
Space Station. Our problem is that they can not be considered for judging
unless they have four students work on the project. Well, my two youngest
are 1 and 4 so that won't work for us. Do any of you have children who
would be in grades 4-6 that would like to participate with my children on
this project? There is only one day left and we are getting desparate. My
son and daughter have developed what they believe is a solution to a
communications challenge and published their Flash presentation at:
www.rjsinternational.com/spaceday . Would you please take a look and if you
have children in the needed age group (NASA's rules, not ours), please
contact us ASAP. You may also call us at (954) 776-5644.

TIA - RJS
